problemAwareness.researchIntro: The information presented is supported by findings from several reputable Danish and Nordic research institutions and agencies:
problemAwareness.sourceGEUS: GEUS (Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland)

educationalContent.mainTitle: Water Wisdom: Understanding Contaminants and Solutions

contaminants.title: Common Water Contaminants in Denmark
contaminants.content:
Pesticides: Residues from agricultural use can seep into groundwater.
Nitrates: Primarily from fertilizers, can be harmful in high concentrations.
Heavy Metals: Such as lead or arsenic, can originate from old pipes or industrial pollution.
Pharmaceutical Residues: Traces of medicines can enter the water supply.

healthImplications.title: Health Implications of Contaminated Water
healthImplications.content: Long-term exposure to certain water contaminants may be associated with various health concerns. For example, nitrates can affect oxygen transport in infants, and some heavy metals are linked to developmental issues or organ damage. Pesticides and pharmaceutical residues are areas of ongoing research regarding their potential long-term health effects.

kangenSolution.title: How Kangen's Ionization Technology Helps
kangenSolution.content: Kangen Water® machines first filter your tap water to reduce common impurities. Then, through a process called electrolysis, the water is ionized, altering its pH and Oxidation-Reduction Potential (ORP). This process aims to produce water that is cleaner and potentially offers antioxidant properties. While not a cure for any disease, Kangen Water® is designed to provide a high-quality drinking water option.
